Module simplifier
Package ie.gmit.dip

Interface AbstractTextSimplifier<T,​U>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - a generic type assigned to the text which is being simplified.
    U - a generic type assigned to the text which has been simplified.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ThesaurusMapTextSimplifier
    public interface AbstractTextSimplifier<T,​U>
    The interface AbstractTextSimplifier is an abstraction of a type which simplifies text. Its primary responsibility is to set some text to be simplified, simplify that text, and return the simplified text. Therefore, it has public getter and setter methods associated with setting and retrieving the text to simplify, as well as a simplify method which runs the conversion/simplification. The interface is configured with generic types, such that concrete types can be configured to take and return arbitrary input, ranging from simple String types, to Collections, to more complex objects.
    Since:
    JavaSE-11
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kieran P. Somers

        Setter method which sets the textToSimplify.

        textToSimplify - the text to simplify can be of any generic type T.

      • getTextToSimplify

        T getTextToSimplify()
        Getter method which returns text to simplify.
        Returns:
        T the text to simplify can be of any generic type T.

      • getSimplifiedText

        U getSimplifiedText()
        Getter method which returns the simplified text.
        Returns:
        U the simplified text can be of generic type U, can be a different type to the input text of type T.

      • simplify

        void simplify()
        Method to run to simplify the text. Concrete types are responsible for the specifics of text simplification.
